column4: hmm I don't get something, I do df -h, then I delete large files, I do df -h again and nothing changed, does it take sometimes to update ?
which large files did you delete?
a text file my website generated
I don't know
if it does not go away it meant there's some process using that file...
the file is removed, but the df -h ddidn't change
as soon as that process terminates it will make the space as available
rob_p also has a good point: check the trash
It's a server I just have a shell, I used rm
yes
can you restart the services?
file.log actually, >100MB
k I gonna try that
btw could you have a look at my partitions please http://nopaste.gamedev.pl/?id=7666
it's the log for what?
it was like that by default
it's a log generated by my website, concerning some activities
I think that my partitions are useless and I need more space in the main one, what can I do ? http://nopaste.gamedev.pl/?id=7666
/dev/md1
if the file was still available you could check which process is using it with lsof or fuser
well I guess it was my bad...anyway, can I do something now concerning the partitions ? Maybe define them better, I don't know what to do
if you used LVM it's possible to change the size of partitions live... if not, you'll have to use something else... or buy a new Hard drive
to find your bigest file, try 'sudo du / | sort -n'
(it might take some time)
